intro: Sida beckii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Sida beckii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
